right.text: In other words, in a discussion in which that statement   would actually contribute to the discussion, how do you bring it up without offending people?

left.text: theres a bit of a social taboo I have a huge problem with. you cant say you're smart, because thats bragging. but how can you communicate that "people generally say I'm smart" without bragging?

right.text: I have an INT of 15 and a WIS of 8 :P

left.text: Here's a way I'll do it, and it's mind-bendingly nerdy!

right.text: So I'm saying "I'm above average intelligence but not exactly a genius, and I have no common sense."

left.text: if you dont know D&D;, 10 is average with a bonus of 0. 8 is below par and has a bonus of -1, 15 is above par and has a bonus of +2. The highest number you can get naturally is 18, the lowest is 3.
